title: Uranus: The Sideways Planet
description: One-minute skill: Uranus: The Sideways Planet.

hook.text: Every planet spins roughly upright. Uranus rolls on its side like a bowling ball.

buildup.text: Its axis is tilted 98 degrees â€” probably knocked over by a massive ancient impact.

discovery.text: This means each pole gets 42 years of continuous sunlight, then 42 years of night.

twist.text: Uranus appears featureless, but Voyager 2 found it has 13 faint rings.

climax.text: Its blue-green color comes from methane absorbing red light in the atmosphere.

punchline.text: One collision billions of years ago left a planet spinning sideways forever.

quiz.question: Why does Uranus spin on its side?
